Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Key elements from the DECLARE model: - Existence and Absence: Ensures certain activities must or must not occur. - Existence: Receive_Application and Gather_Additional_Documents must happen. - Absence: Proceed_Without_Compliance must not happen – this is critical for compliance. - Exactly One: Preliminary_Credit_Check happens exactly once – probably to avoid redundant checks. - Init: Receive_Application is the starting point. - Responded Existence, Coexistence, Response, etc.: These are more relational constraints. - For example, Responded Existence: If Assemble_Loan_Offer_Package happens, Quality_Assurance_Review must happen. - Coexistence: If Gather_Additional_Documents happens, Authorize_Contract_Terms must happen. - Response: If Receive_Application happens, Preliminary_Credit_Check must respond. - Precedence, Succession: Define orders, like Quality_Assurance_Review before Authorize_Contract_Terms. - There are also negative constraints like Noncoexistence, Nonsuccession, which prevent certain combinations or sequences.
